chapter.title: Service Handler bindings
chapter.para: Service Handler Bindings are used to allow the declaration of interfaces and abstract classes as implemented beans. Any call to an abstract method on the interface or abstract class will be forwarded to the invocation layer for processing. This specification defines a typesafe mechanism for associating service handlers to abstract classes and interfaces using service handler bindings.

listitem.para: A Service Handler is different from a Decorator so that the interface is unknown at runtime.
A Service Handler is different from an Interceptor so that the implementation of the method is provided instead of cross-cutting concerns.

section.title: Service Handler binding types
section.para: An service handler binding type may be declared by specifying the @javax.servicehandler.ServiceHandlerBinding meta-annotation.
